title: GT &shortversion; C WS Core : System Administrator's Guide

section.title: Introduction
section.para: This guide contains advanced configuration information for system administrators working with C WS Core. It provides references to information on procedures typically performed by system administrators, including installation, configuring, deploying, and testing the installation.

important.simpara: This information is in addition to the basic Globus Toolkit prerequisite, overview, installation, security configuration instructions in the . Read through this guide before continuing!

section.title: Building and Installing
section.para: In order to build and install the C WS-Core component from an official release:

table.title: Building C WS Core from installer

entry.para:
Obtain the latest GT 4.x.x release tarball installer from the
Download webpage.
Untar the tarball: tar xvfz gt<version>-all-source-installer.tar.gz
Change to the installer directory: cd gt<version>-all-source-installer

section.para: In order to build C WS Core from CVS:

table.title: Building C WS Core from CVS

entry.para: Obtain the source code for C WS Core from CVS:

listitem.para: To get the latest source from CVS execute: cvs -d :pserver:anonymous@cvs.globus.org:/home/globdev/CVS/globus-packages \ checkout packaging
Change into the packaging directory. cd packaging

row.entry:
Set the GLOBUS_LOCATION environment variable to the absolute path of the target directory of your installation.
On Unix/Linux: setenv GLOBUS_LOCATION /soft/gt4/ or export GLOBUS_LOCATION=/soft/gt4/

section.title: Deploying
section.para: The C WS-Core does not require configuration/deployment steps. All parameter configuration is done programmatically at present.

section.title: Testing
section.para: The C WS-Core has a test suite that tests a number of different packages included in the component. The tests can be built using either the wsctests target to make in the installer of a release, or they can be built using the gt4-c-ws-core-test bundle in the ./make-packages.pl command mentioned previously.
The tests are installed into $GLOBUS_LOCATION/test, and can be run from the appropriate sub-directories.

section.title: Troubleshooting
section.para: This is a new component. If you are having trouble using it, please let us know!
